results.title: Live forever
results.creator_credit: John Dower, John Battsek, BBC, Film Council, Horsebridge Productions and Passion Pictures
results.brief_description: Anecdotally hilarious documentary about the rise and fall of Brit-Pop in the 1990s and all it encompassed as a cultural phenomenon. This work assesses the mood of the times, or “Cool Britannia” as it was known, and the reasons why it was, for a while, great to be British; also addresses the role that Tony Blair and New Labor played, throwing off the drudgery of Thatcherism, embracing all that was new and youthful; and the band war between Oasis and Blur, played out on the pages on NME. Consisting almost entirely of interviews, the filmmakers have enhanced classic raw material with jazzy and judicious editing. From the insightful to the ridiculous, this is far from an exhaustive piece, but it provides an astute and witty snapshot of the times.

results.title: Live and let live
results.creator_credit: Peter Ward, Cyril Randell and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: Lack of proper care during the handling of cargo is the cause of frequent accidents on the docks. Safety regulations, safe equipment, and marked safe working loads help, but safe working men are the most important. Stresses teamwork, building proper stacks, and breaking them down correctly, using mechanical equipment with care and realising the risks involved around the hold where uneven footing leads to falls and foot injuries.

results.title: Live a life
results.creator_credit: Maxim Ford, Sally Hibbin and Parallax Pictures
results.brief_description: A concert for the unemployed was staged at the Rainbow with a line-up that included Tom Robinson, the Beat, Black Slate, OK Jive and Alexei Sayle. This film is a record of that concert and of the situation which prompted it. Discussions with the young unemployed are set against the rhetoric of the Thatcher regime.

results.title: Liu awaiting spring
results.creator_credit: Andrew Soo, Nadine Umback, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Over Exposed Productions
results.brief_description: Set against traditional Chinese music and imagery such as calligraphy and performance art a young gay Chinese man faces the dilemma of “coming out” to his family. His dilemma is complicated by the fact that one of their relatives has died from AIDS.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Soo, Nadine Umback, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Over Exposed Productions

results.title: Little white lies
results.brief_description: Focused on developments in communication technology, this fast paced morality farce features modern convenience as an inexhaustible persecutor. Reb finds that when you’ve got a secret and they’ve got your number, a little white lie can sometimes do wonders - but not always.

results.title: Little white crimes
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, John Kemeny and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A tale from downtown, where the morality of business is not always as transparent as the shining glass fronts of the office buildings. The film follows the adventures of a young man on the way up, intent on building an image to match his ambitions. In doing so he leaves a trail of hurt feelings among those he uses as steps toward his goal. A useful film for the discussion of business ethics.

results.title: Little Tom Thumb (K)
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: The dream of escaping from poverty and unhappiness comes true when Little Tom Thumb becomes a hero - saving himself and his six big brothers, and returning home with treasure and magic boots. Animation by Harold Whitaker.

results.title: Little Tim and the brave sea captain (K)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: This film captures the feel of salt in a seaside village and the rigours of shipboard life through the adventures of Tim, a gallant stowaway. The sweeping power of the wild ocean and angry sky, and a swirl of greens and greys are forcefully projected while lively sea shanties and the call of gulls accent the storytelling. Based on the well known children’s book by Edward Ardizzone.

results.title: Little skills mean a lot
results.brief_description: Leading sports commentator, Sandy Roberts introduces the Australian Football skills and drills film, highlighting the LITTLE things in football which are essential for team success. Skills drills on tackling, smothering, evasion, ball-handling, crumb gathering, kicking to position etc are presented by leading Victorian Junior Coach, Ray ‘Slug’ Jordan and VFL Development Manager, Kevin Sheehan.
